examples: My grandmother gave me some wise advice.
It was a wise decision to save money for the future.

definitions: To cover something by putting paper or other material around it.
To enclose an object for protection or as a gift.
To put your arms around someone.
To arrange a covering around an item.
examples: I need to wrap this birthday present.
She wrapped the baby in a warm blanket.

definitions: A formal way to end a letter in British English when you know the recipient's name.
A conventional closing for a formal letter.
A polite valediction used before a signature.
Similar to 'Sincerely yours' in American English.
examples: He finished his letter with 'Yours sincerely, John Smith'.
If you begin with 'Dear Mr. Jones,' you should end with 'Yours sincerely'.

definitions: The faculty by which a person decides on and initiates action.
Control exerted to do something or restrain impulses.
Strong determination.
A legal document stating a person's wishes for their property after death.
examples: It takes strong will to quit smoking.
She has a will of iron.
